intro: Crotalaria bongensis var. camerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an erect annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in racemes, and it produces oblong pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and agricultural fields.
